definition: to say one and mean just that (idiom); to keep one's word
the one and only way/the only proper course to take

sentences.english: A monetary rule is a requisite for restoring the Fed’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 貨幣規則是重建美聯儲獨立性的不二法門。

sentences.english: They asked me how I knew my true love was true.
sentences.chinese: 他們問我怎麼知道我的摯愛對我永遠忠貞不二的。

sentences.english: In fact, V-Kool is an energy-saving product as well.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，使用威固還是節能省耗的不二選擇。

sentences.english: The first rule in winning is to participate!
sentences.chinese: 參與是獲得勝利的不二法門。

sentences.english: Images are agood way to catch a visitors attention.
sentences.chinese: 圖像歷來是吸引眼球的不二法門。

sentences.english: Take in fewer calories than you burn, and you lose weight.
sentences.chinese: 喫得比你消耗的少，是減肥的不二法門。

sentences.english: The old squad leader is a man of his word; he never makes a promise he cannot keep.
sentences.chinese: 老班長是說一不二的，他答應的事一定能辦到。

sentences.english: He serves me most, who serves his country best – Homer.
sentences.chinese: 他對我矢志不渝，而我對國家忠貞不二。

sentences.english: To limited freedom of press is the best choice of authority.
sentences.chinese: 限制新聞自由成爲權力者立法的不二選擇。

sentences.english: Maybe you want to show your boss that you are good enough to get that promotion.
sentences.chinese: 也許你想讓你的老闆知道，你是這次晉升的不二人選。

sentences.english: Can you come down a little? --Sorry, its one price for all.
sentences.chinese: 你能便宜一點賣嗎？對不起，不二價。

sentences.english: But good husbands take their wives at their word.
sentences.chinese: 但好丈夫對妻子總是說一不二。

sentences.english: Can you come down a little? --Sorry, it's one price for all.
sentences.chinese: 你能自制一點賣嗎？對不起，不二價。

sentences.english: The man is the only proper course to take, should never let him meet.
sentences.chinese: 抓住男人的不二法門，應該就是，永遠不要讓他滿足。

sentences.english: I'm afraid not, sir. The prices are fixed.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕不能，先生，我們是不二價的。

definition: the Way of the King/statecraft/benevolent rule/virtuous as opposed to the Way of Hegemon 霸道
the one and only way/the only proper course to take
to become fashionable/to catch on/to be popular
abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)
permanent/constant/fixed/usual/ordinary/rule (old)/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷟)
